body: Removing the `_alias_into_sparse` in the existing code probably won't save us a lot because it will be replaced with `set_indices_and_values_unsafe` and we still need to clean them up when the flag is enabled by default. We should probably just leave the wrapper as is right now.
body_html: Removing the _alias_into_sparse in the existing code probably won't save us a lot because it will be replaced with set_indices_and_values_unsafe and we still need to clean them up when the flag is enabled by default. We should probably just leave the wrapper as is right now.
body_text: Removing the _alias_into_sparse in the existing code probably won't save us a lot because it will be replaced with set_indices_and_values_unsafe and we still need to clean them up when the flag is enabled by default. We should probably just leave the wrapper as is right now.
